question: Inferior turbinate is a:
exp: The superior and middle turbinates are pas of ethmoid bone whereas inferior turbinate is an independent separate bone.

question: Onodi cells and haller cells are seen in relation to:
exp: "Onodi cell" is the posterior most posterior ethmoid cell extending lateral to the sphenoid sinus. While removing disease from the Onodi cells there are chances of injury to optic nerve and internal carotid which lie in the vicinity. The posterior ethmoidal cells in the floor of orbit are known as "Haller cells".
opa: Optic nerve and floor of orbit
opc: Optic nerve and ethmoid air cells

question: Direction of Nasolacrimal Duct is
exp: O Nasolacrimal duct opens in anterior pa of inferior meatus. O Direction of nasolacrimal duct is Backwards (Inwards), laterally and downwards (pneumonic: NLD). It courses anterior to maxillary ostium O Opening of nasolacrimal duct is guarded by Hasner's mucosal valve

question: Nasolacrimal duct opens into which meatus?
exp: O Nasolacrimal duct opens in the inferior meatus just anterior to its highest point O It is closed by a mucosal flap called Hasner's valve MEATUS SINUS DRAINING Superior meatus Posterior ethmoid sinus Middle meatus Maxillary sinus Anterior Ethmoid sinus Frontal sinus Inferior meatus Nasolacrimal duct Sphenoethmoidal recess Sphenoid sinus
